intro: Raphionacme elata, commonly known as the tall raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Raphionacme elata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
